entry.title: Stryker4s: from 40 minutes to 40 seconds
entry.summary: Stryker4s is your friendly mutation testing framework for Scala. Compared to earlier versions, Stryker4s 0.12 achieves a 60x speed increase in some scenarios ðŸ¤¯. Are you curious to know how? Keep on reading.

entry.title: Announcing StrykerJS 5.0 - Brave new Dimension
entry.summary: We're proud to announce the next major release of StrykerJS: 5.0. With a name change, a new dimension in your report, a new way to discover files, updated mutators, quality of life improvements, and minor bug fixes.

entry.title: Announcing Stryker 4.0 - Mutation Switching
entry.summary: We're proud to announce the next major release of the Stryker mutation testing framework for JavaScript and friends: Stryker 4.0.

entry.title: Announcing Stryker 4.0 Beta
entry.summary: We're excited to announce the beta of the next major release of the Stryker mutation testing framework for JavaScript and friends: Stryker 4.0.

entry.title: Integrating Stryker.NET in your azure pipelines
entry.summary: Over the past few months we have been working hard to integrate Stryker.NET with azure pipelines. Learn how you can leverage our new features to include mutation testing in your continuous integration.

entry.title: Announcing Stryker 100% mode
entry.summary: Over the years, we've been privileged to explain the concept of Mutation Testing to great developers, testers and others.

entry.title: Announcing Stryker 3.0
entry.summary: With version 3 of Stryker, we've been focussing on usability. We also did some smaller changes worth pointing out.

entry.title: Host your mutation testing report
entry.summary: ðŸ“Š The Stryker Dashboard can now host your mutation testing report in the cloud.

entry.title: Announcing Stryker 2.0
entry.summary: A new major version of Stryker for JavaScript and TypeScript has been released: version 2.0.0.

entry.title: Announcing Stryker.NET 0.10 with .NET Framework support
entry.summary: Stryker.NET 0.10 is here! This brings new features to mutation testing for .NET. Read all about these features in this blog.

entry.title: One mutation testing HTML report
entry.summary: If you've used Stryker before, you'll know that it produces a gorgeous report you can view in the browser.

entry.title: Announcing Stryker 1.0
entry.summary: Stryker 1.0 is here! This is an important milestone for mutation testing in JavaScript and TypeScript.

entry.title: Stryker4s 0.1.0 released
entry.summary: This is the first official release of Stryker4s! Bringing easy mutation testing to Scala sbt projects. And it comes with some great features.

entry.title: Announcing Stryker 0.34
entry.summary: Stryker 0.34 is here. This new version comes with features to help you get started. It's never been this easy to mutation test your JS project!

entry.title: Mutation switching in Stryker4s
entry.summary: Learn how Stryker4s uses mutation switching to improve performance.

entry.title: Introducing Stryker.NET and Stryker4s
entry.summary: We're excited to announce that we're doubling the number of supported languages for Stryker. We already had support for JavaScript and Typescript, and now both C# and Scala are supported as preview versions. Try them out and let us know what you think.

entry.title: Use git to select files
entry.summary: The 0.21 release of Stryker simplifies configuration by using your git database.

entry.title: Get your mutation score badge now!
entry.summary: We're launching our Stryker Dashboard today.

entry.title: Webpack support is here
entry.summary: Stryker now supports bundling your code using webpack before running your tests.

entry.title: TypeScript coverage analysis support
entry.summary: Let's start this new year strong. Stryker 0.18 adds coverage analysis support for transpilers, starting with the TypeScript transpiler.

entry.title: Stryker adds Babel support
entry.summary: A new Stryker plugin that adds support for Babel projects has just been released!

entry.title: New HTML reporter
entry.summary: The Stryker HTML Reporter version 0.10 has a lot of new features, but more importantly: a sexy new look.

entry.title: TypeScript support
entry.summary: Stryker 0.10 marks the biggest change in Stryker history yet, as we now support running mutation testing on TypeScript code.

entry.title: Stryker 0.8 release
entry.summary: Stryker 0.8 just released with better CI integration and configurable thresholds.

entry.title: Road to Stryker 1.0
entry.summary: Stryker is about two years old. During this time we achieved a lot. But it's far from finished. So, what's next? Let's take a glimpse in the future.

entry.title: Stryker 0.6.4 released
entry.summary: This release of Stryker brings a number of new features and improvements. Including a new quickstart and a number of reporter improvements.

entry.title: Stryker weekend
entry.summary: During the last weekend of January we spent a weekend with ten students from the HAN University and University of Twente developing valuable features for Stryker!

entry.title: Introduction to mutation testing
entry.summary: Writing unit tests can be hard. Even for an easy example such as a calculator app.

entry.title: Happy new Stryker!
entry.summary: 2017 - The year to invest into test quality

entry.title: Stryker 0.5.5 released!
entry.summary: The full changelog can be found on GitHub. In this post we'll dive into a couple of new features.
